com.yantra.api.vas

Interface modifyWorkOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.VASApi, YIFApi

    public interface modifyWorkOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document modifyWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      modifyWorkOrder modifies a work order according to the values passed.

    • Method Detail

      • modifyWorkOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document modifyWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                     org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                              throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                     java.rmi.RemoteException
        modifyWorkOrder modifies a work order according to the values passed. Certain attributes of work order and related entities can be modified using the API. Modifications are subject to Modification Rules configured for work order for various statuses.

        InvUpdateActivityCode on the work order will be set to the last activity's ActivityCode whenever the corresponding activity is deleted.

        The additional required capacity for the work order will be computed based on the region that the ship to address falls under and the service type of the service items. Additional required capacity of each delivery service item will be treated as part of its fixed capacity. If there are more than one delivery service items in the work order, the maximum fixed capacity across the delivery service items in the work order will be used as the fixed required capacity of the work order.

        All work order related tables (Work order Activity, Appointment, Component and Appointment user) will be audited using platform's entity-auditing that capture's audit of all attribute. AUDIT_TRAN_KEY and AUDIT_CONTEXT_ID fields from YFS_ Work_Order_Sts_Audit table are used as Audit references to YFS_AUDIT and YFS_AUDIT_HEADER tables.Refer below for detaliled Audit references for work order related tables. Only YFS_WORK_ORDER attributes, whose modification type has AuditRequired set to Y, will be audited.

        Pre-Call Status

        PreCallStatus is determined whenever the PromisedApptStartDate is changed, and when the work order is first created. For PS and DS work orders, this status will be automatically set based on the pre-call rules. Possible pre-call statuses include:

        • NOT_APPLICABLE - The pre-call status is automatically set to this if the work order does not have an appointment.
        • NOT_REQUIRED - This status indicates that either: a.) No pre-call condition is specified b.) The work order does not meet the requirements for pre-call or c.) The work order does meet the requirements, but the current appointment start date is within the pre-call lead time.
        • PENDING - This status indicates that the work order meets the requirement condition for pre-call and the promised appointment start date is beyond the lead time for pre-call.
        • SUCCESSFUL - This status indicates that the pre-call was successful. The system will not automatically set this status. Instead, the modifyWorkOrder API should be invoked passing PreCallStatus after the pre-call is performed.
        • FAILED - This status indicates that the pre-call was unsuccessful. The system will not automatically set this status. Instead, the modifyWorkOrder API should be invoked passing PreCallStatus after the pre-call is performed.

        Events Raised:
        Raised under the transaction MODIFY_WORK_ORDER
          ON_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE:
            This event is raised for each hold type where the status has been changed.
            Data published - VAS_ON_HOLD_TYPE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt
          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of modifyWorkOrder.
            Data published - VAS_MODIFY_WORK_ORDER.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt
          ON_PLANNING_COMPLETE:
            This event is raised if the PlanningComplete attribute on the work Order is set to "Y", indicating that the planning is complete on this work order.
            Data published - VAS_CREATE_WORK_ORDER.ON_PLANNING_COMPLETE.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt
          ATTENTION_REQUIRED:
            The API raises this event when AttentionRequired is switched from No to Yes. Specific to provided service work order.
            Data published - VAS_MODIFY_WORK_ORDER.ATTENTION_REQUIRED.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt

          ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order. This event is configured under transaction ORDER_CHANGE
            Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Template Support:
            Yes

        Raised under the transaction CAPACITY_CHANGE
          EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when capacity consumptions are changed.
            Data published - YFS_CAPACITY_CHANGE.EXTERNAL_CAPACITY_CHANGE.xml
            Template Support: Yes

        Template Support: Yes.

        Audits: Yes

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support:
        Supported for all the elements except:

          Status
          PersonInfo

        Additional Information

        Work Order for Return and Exchange Order

          A single work order can be used for a return and exchange order. The lines of return order corresponding to the exchange order can be added to work order.
          If exchange order lines are added to a return order's work order, work order is switched to exchange order's work order i.e. the order information on the work order will be that of the exchange order instead of return order.
          In such orders the product amount displayed is the maximum of the total product amount of return order and exchange order.
          On cancellation of exchange order the work order will be switched to return order's work order i.e. the order information on the work order will be that of the return order instead of exchange order.
          Calculated capacity for a PS will be based on all provided services on the work order (both from exchange and return orders). However, for delivery services only those lines that are part of the exchange order will impact capacity including weight and volume. If the work order is for a return order only, then capacity is calculated based on return lines.

        Ability to switch between PS and DS work orders.

          By adding a PS line to a DS work order or by removing last PS line from a PS work order that contains other DS lines, work order will be switched based on the remaining lines. While the switch the following attributes will be updated:
          Service Item Group Code
          Required Capacity
          Capacity Unit Of Measure
          Complexity Level
          Work Order Appointments (in case new capacity cannot be blocked, old appointments will remain as is)
          Node, Provider Organization, and Supervisor will not be updated and are assumed to remain the same.
        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details about the work order modified. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
